Search results

phasor

Resettable linear ramp between two levels [trig 0.0, rate 1.0, start 0.0, end 1.0, reset-pos 0.0] trig - When triggered, reset value to reset-pos (default: 0, phasor outputs start initially) rate - The amount of change per sample i.e at a rate of 1 the value of each sample will be 1 greater than the preceding sample start - Starting point of the ramp end - End point of the ramp reset-pos - The value to jump to upon receiving a trigger Phasor is a linear ramp between start and end values. When its trigger input crosses from non-positive to positive, Phasor's output will jump to its reset position. Upon reaching the end of its ramp Phasor will wrap back to its start. N.B. Since end is defined as the wrap point, its value is never actually output. Categories: Triggers, Buffer Rates: [ :ar, :kr ] Default rate: :kr
